required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in Open Gynecological, Urological, ENT, Head, Neck, and Vascular Surgeries
clinical_study.official_title: Post-Market Evaluation of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows Performance and Safety in Open Gynecological, Urological, ENT, Head and Neck, and Vascular Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, multi-center, multi-national single arm study to evaluate the performance and safety of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in open gynecological, urological, ENT and head and neck, and vascular surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, multi-center, multi-national single arm study conducted in Austria, France, and Germany to evaluate the performance and safety of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows in open gynecological, urological, ENT, head and neck, and vascular surgery. Up to 120 subjects will be enrolled at up to 10 sites, with a minimum of 8 subjects enrolled in each surgical specialty.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperatively, expected within 3-10 minutes of application
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects for which hemostasis was achieved after application of HEMOBLAST™ Bellows.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, prior to surgical closure of the subject
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of target bleeding site re-bleeding after hemostasis has been achieved with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-operatively, expected within 1-30 days of the surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of re-operation due to post-operative bleeding/hemorrhage after treatment with HEMOBLAST™ Bellows

intervention.description: Surgeon has chosen to use HEMOBLAST™ Bellows as an adjunct to hemostasis when control of minimal, mild, or moderate bleeding by conventional procedures is ineffective or impractical in gynecological, urological, vascular, ENT and head and neck surgeries.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects undergoing open gynecological, urological, ENT and head and neck, and vascular procedures that meet all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria.

facility.name: Kliniken der Stadt Koln, Krankenhaus Merheim
